articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli tanks conducted a second day of probing attacks across Rafah on Wednesday, after Washington said the assault did not amount to a major ground incursion of the southern Gazan city that U.S. officials had told Israel to avoid.
articles.title: Israel sends tanks into Rafah on raids amid Gaza-wide offensive

articles.author: Anait Miridzhanian, Nqobile Dludla
articles.description: South Africans began voting on Wednesday in the most competitive election since the end of apartheid, with opinion polls suggesting the African National Congress (ANC) will lose its parliamentary majority after 30 years in government.
articles.title: South Africans vote in most competitive election since end of apartheid

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Iran fires the starting gun this week on an election to replace President Ebrahim Raisi, whose death in a helicopter crash could complicate efforts by the authorities to manage a task of even greater consequence - the succession to the supreme leader.
articles.title: Iran's Khamenei seeks trusted hardliner to replace Raisi in June vote

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: The delivery of U.S. weapons to Ukraine is helping stabilize the frontline of the battlefield, U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken said on Wednesday, adding that Washington was working hard to deliver more air defenses to Ukraine.
articles.title: Delivery of US weapons to Ukraine helping stabilize frontline, Blinken says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Sudan's army on Wednesday rejected a call to return to peace talks with the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces following a conversation between General Abdel Fattah al-Burhan and U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken.
articles.title: Sudan's army rejects US call to return to peace talks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A volcano in southwestern Iceland erupted on Wednesday, live video from the area showed, making it the fifth outbreak since December.
articles.title: Volcano in Iceland erupts again

articles.author: Harold Isaac
articles.description: Haiti's transition council on Tuesday tapped former Prime Minister Garry Conille, who briefly led the country over a decade ago, to return to the role as the Caribbean nation works to restore stability and take back control from violent gangs.
articles.title: Haiti transition council taps former PM Conille to again lead country

articles.author: Sabine Siebold, Andrew Gray
articles.description: NATO foreign ministers will on Friday debate a military support package for Ukraine, proposed by alliance boss Jens Stoltenberg and due to be agreed at a summit in Washington in July.
articles.title: Explainer: What is NATO chief's proposal for military aid for Ukraine?

articles.author: Ana Martinez
articles.description: Mexico's presidential candidates are set to formally end their campaigns on Wednesday ahead of Sunday's election, in which polls show ruling party candidate Claudia Sheinbaum on course to become the country's first woman president.
articles.title: Mexico's presidential hopefuls wrap up campaigns ahead of historic election

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Yemen's Iran-aligned Houthis said they downed a U.S. MQ-9 drone in Yemen's southeastern province of Maareb, the group's military spokesman said in a televised speech on Wednesday.
articles.title: Yemen's Houthis say they downed US MQ-9 drone in Yemen's Maareb
